meanings.definition: A device that extracts a signal from a carrier wave.
meanings.sent1: The demodulators in our lab help us separate the important information from the carrier wave.
meanings.sent2: Technicians use demodulators to retrieve data from radio signals.
meanings.sent3: The demodulators at the concert were like magic wands pulling music out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her ears acted as demodulators, deciphering the melody hidden within the noise.
meanings.sent5: The demodulators hummed softly as they worked their signal-extracting magic.

meanings.definition: The process of removing modulation from a signal.
meanings.sent1: Demodulators are essential in cleaning up signals by removing unnecessary modulation.
meanings.sent2: During the transmission, demodulators strip away the added layers to reveal the original message.
meanings.sent3: The demodulators at the party were like detectives solving the mystery of the distorted signal.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, demodulators were tiny cleaners meticulously scrubbing the signal clean.
meanings.sent5: The demodulators worked tirelessly, peeling off layers of modulation to unveil the pure signal within.
